Name of the module, theme, or layout Breakpoints Link to the drupal.org module, theme, or layout https://www.drupal.org/project/breakpoints Related forum post https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/al...

@BWPanda Does Srcset Images have that same functionality? I've looked at it and installed it but having a bit of a hard time figuring out the final steps for configuring it and telling it which styles are intended for which widths/breakpoints...

@Laryn I haven't used it in a while, but I think you just setup image styles (e.g. slideshow-desktop, slideshow-mobile, etc.) then configure srcset images to reference those... Maybe I can help more with a more specific question or screenshots...
I think I just can't figure out how you tell srcset which image style is for mobile, which one is for desktop, for example. Screen-Shot-2020-09-11-at-7.19.29-AM.jpg

@Laryn Ah. Here's a quote from the module's README:

srcset lets you specify different image variants which the browser chooses between based on the screen size. For example, you can specify a large, medium and small variant of a particular image; then, depending on the user's screen size, the browser will automatically load the appropriately-sized image.

You don't choose specific sizes for specific devices, the browser does that.

This might help too: https://html.com/attributes/img-srcset/

What Img Srcset Does In HTML5: A Quick & Simple Guide
Defines multiple sizes of the same image, allowing the browser to select the appropriate image source.
